meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.a: The Plan To Message Aliens With Twitter

div.div: If youâ€™ve ever pondered what you would say to an alien, you may get that chance between 7:30 and 8 p.m. PT tonight.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Pv6GAC&via=Digg&text=The Plan To Message Aliens With Twitter

div.a: Facebook Starts Letting You View And Delete Your Facebook Search History

div.div: Facebook is now allowing you to view and delete all or part of your search history through the profile Activity Log. The new feature will give you more transparency into what you do on Facebook, what it tracks, and make you feel like youâ€™re more in control.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Q2V1uA&via=Digg&text=Facebook Starts Letting You View And Delete Your Facebook Search History

div.a: Not Wanting Kids Is Entirely Normal

div.div: How the ingrained expectation that women should want to become parents is detrimental and unhealthy.

div.a: The Best Cell Phone Commercial From 1989

li.div: Weighed the iPhone 5 & Galaxy S III but went with this instead. Feeling pretty good about my choice. http://t.co/pV2P3Ooe

div.div: Is the new iPhone 5 more durable than its predecessors?
"I can confirm that the Verizon iPhone 5 is indeed GSM unlocked."

div.a: 'Gangnam Style' Dance-Off Escalates Into Gang Shootout

div.div: Gangnam Style has inspired a West Side Story-esque show of rivalry between two Bangkok gangs who are said to have had a dance-off before engaging in a gun battle.

li.div: Take a second to appreciate this headline: 'Gangnam Style dance-off escalates into gang shootout in Bangkok' guardian.co.uk/world/2012/...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UyYGkU&via=Digg&text='Gangnam Style' Dance-Off Escalates Into Gang Shootout

div.a: Google Maps Announces A 400 Year Advantage Over Apple Maps

div.div: The issue plaguing Apple Maps is not mathematics or algorithms, it is data quality and there can be little doubt about the types of errors that are plaguing the system.

li.div: Re: iOS 6 maps, this is the best summary I've read: "Their problem is that they thought they did not have a problem." blog.telemapics.com/?p=399

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Q0qhKG&via=Digg&text=Google Maps Announces A 400 Year Advantage Over Apple Maps

div.a: You Don't Need A F*cking Case For Your iPhone 5

div.div: I've never used a case for my iPhone 4. Not even after the back broke for the third time. I didn't do it because, unlike my grandma, I don't cover my sofas with plastic. Or unlike idiots, I don't protect my car's front with a bra.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/P5NxUT&via=Digg&text=You Don't Need A F*cking Case For Your iPhone 5

div.div: Will Kelly Clarkson be remembered in 2042?

div.a: How To Confuse Someone's Moral Compass

div.div: People can be tricked into reversing their opinions on moral issues, even to the point of constructing good arguments to support the opposite of their original positions.

li.div: This is incredible. Simple trick gets people to reverse their moral attitudes nature.com/news/how-to-con...

div.a: Was This Iconic Photo Just A Publicity Stunt?

div.div: In the run up to this photo's 80th anniversary it has emerged that, far from catching the subjects unaware, the image was set up as a publicity shot for the Rockefeller Center.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/T5V6kr&via=Digg&text=Was This Iconic Photo Just A Publicity Stunt?

div.a: Anti-Jihad Ads Going Up In NYC Subway

div.div: A provocative ad that equates Muslim radicals with savages is set to go up in the city's subway system as violent protests over an anti-Islamic film ridiculing the Prophet Muhammad sweep over much of the Muslim world.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UjArZp&via=Digg&text=Anti-Jihad Ads Going Up In NYC Subway

div.a: This Is How You Attach A Space Shuttle To The Top Of An Airplane

div.div: At the Shuttle Landing Facility at NASA's Kennedy Space Center in Florida, space shuttle Endeavour is mounted atop NASA's Shuttle Carrier Aircraft, or SCA, in preparation for its ferry flight to California.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QkJuE6&via=Digg&text=This Is How You Attach A Space Shuttle To The Top Of An Airplane
